Title: Software Development Engineer in Test III
RoleDescription:
Are you passionate about building high-quality mobile experiences that impact millions of users? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where quality is at the forefront? Peloton is looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Android Test Engineer to help us deliver flawless Android applications that power our industry-leading fitness experiences.
In this role, youll work closely with developers, product managers, and cross-functional teams to ensure our Android applications meet the highest quality standards. From automated testing to performance optimization, youll play a key role in shaping the reliability and usability of our products.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Design, develop, and execute test plans to validate Android applications across different devices and OS versions.
Create, automate, and optimize test cases to improve efficiency and coverage.
Collaborate with developers to identify, document, and troubleshoot bugs and performance issues.
Ensure seamless system integration, verifying compatibility across hardware, firmware, and backend services.
Analyze and report test results, providing key insights on product quality.
Work with CI/CD pipelines to integrate automated testing into the development workflow.
Advocate for best practices in testing, debugging, and performance monitoring.
Ensure smooth and stable app releases, including over-the-air updates and feature rollouts.

WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON

3+ years of experience in testing primarily Android applications with overall 5 years of experience
Strong knowledge of Android OS, system applications, and debugging tools.
Experience with mobile test automation frameworks (Appium, Espresso, UI Automator, etc.).
Familiarity with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, CircleCI, GitHub Actions) and version control (Git).
Hands-on experience with API testing and backend validation.
Strong analytical skills with a passion for troubleshooting and debugging.
Ability to work in agile, cross-functional teams.
Bonus points for Python or Kotlin experience in test automation.

Title: Manager, SOX and Risk Assurance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a highly-motivated leader to join our growing SOX & Risk Assurance team, working primarily with our Precor business unit. This role will be responsible for operating as the Second Line of Defense within the Accounting Organization, establishing and maintaining policies and procedures that help monitor and enhance the companys global control environment and support management (First Line) in the identification of emerging risks. The SOX Manager will be a trusted business partner helping to design and optimize business processes and controls, while also operating as the primary liaison with internal audit (Third Line) and our external auditors on SOX compliance. The ideal candidate has a detailed knowledge of SOX and COSO framework, strong business process acumen, excellent communication and critical thinking skills, and an ability to collaborate effectively across a range of internal and external partners. This role offers a great opportunity to learn and grow within a high energy and innovative organization.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work within the Second Line of Defense (SOX) team, acting as an advisor to the business and driving the design, implementation and monitoring of Peloton's risk and control framework
Lead and manage all aspects of SOX work for a newly implemented and maturing SOX program for the Precor business with a sense of urgency - from planning, design, testing, reporting and remediation.
Develop and maintain/update process documentation, procedures and controls, including flowcharts and Risk and Control Matrices; document narratives as vital.
Conduct process walkthroughs and risk assessments, evaluating design effectiveness of key business process controls; if deficiencies are identified, partner with management to design appropriate remediation plans with feasible timelines and monitor remediation to completion.
Provide guidance and support to control owners if they propose process or system changes (e.g.implementation of new systems, impact assessment for changes in people, process or technology).
Provide timely and proactive updates to the SOX & Finance leadership team on key risks, gaps, process enhancements, or any areas of potential concern.
Prepare and provide regular training on SOX and control requirements, risk management, and other relevant areas (e.g. management review controls, IPE procedures, etc.) to educate business process owners and reiterate the importance of compliance
Partner with the IT SOX team to ensure alignment on SOX approach, timing, controls reliance, external audit reliance, etc.
Provide creative input that will drive process efficiency across the organization and make valuable contributions to the audit process.
Establish and maintain excellent relationships within the team and cross-functional teams.
Find opportunities to leverage IT solutions to automate processes and create efficiencies in financial processes and strengthen internal controls.
Coordinate activities and strategies with internal and external auditors.
Participate in the preparation of leadership and Audit Committee materials.
Perform other related special studies or projects as assigned, meeting deadlines.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

BA/BS degree in Accounting/Finance or related field. CPA, CIA, or CISA preferred.
5+ years of relevant Internal Audit or SOX experience
Mix of private and public accounting experience (assurance or advisory) at a Big 4 or national public accounting firm.
Strong business process acumen and knowledge of standard processes and best practice, with direct experience with Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Inventory and Financial Statement Close processes.
Working knowledge of IT systems - SAP, Salesforce, home grown systems, etc. and data analytics tools.
Highly organized, motivated, meticulous with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Flexible and able to adapt quickly in a fast-moving environment; able to easily manage competing priorities and deadlines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically to find solutions that meet compliance requirements while supporting business operations and objectives

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
We are looking for a Sr. Operations Program Manager (Sr. OPM) with experience leading complex programs. The Sr. OPM will be a key operations interface in partnership to other OPMs, Product Development, and Supply Chain teams, as well as other functional organizations within Peloton. This role focuses on building strategic systems to support product operations from development to end of life operations, and delivers data-driven insights into the performance of our internal operations.

Effective collaboration with leadership, including at the executive level.

Experience in strategic planning and portfolio management across teams.


Experience working with program management and PLM tools such as Windchill, Jira, Confluence, Smartsheets, Google Drive.

Collaborate with Production, other Post-production teams, and Vendors to ensure the timely delivery of assets.

Catalog products/classes in a content management database accessible to both at-home subscribers and employees.
Assign and monitor key tasks related to media movement, edit support, and asset delivery.
Collaborate with various departments and stakeholders to bring post-production projects to completion.
Make decisions under pressure amidst competing priorities and provide clear direction.
Evaluate team members through training programs and individual feedback in collaboration with management.
Edit videos, audio, and graphics, performing color correction to ensure adherence to quality standards and specifications.
Review content from rough cut through final delivery, including the publication of videos on our platform.
Manage media across various platforms and uphold naming conventions across media folder structures.
Handle ad hoc requests for relevant stakeholders and departments.
Provide insights for workflow improvements to enhance efficiency.
Demonstrate excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Oversee and execute all assigned post-production projects from shoot to publish.
Assign, schedule, track, and project manage video and audio edits from start to distribution.
Manage multiple projects across departments and key stakeholders.
Coordinate internal teams and external vendors to ensure appropriate resourcing.
Ensure projects are completed efficiently and on schedule, managing priorities as needed.
Review content throughout the post-process, offering quality-control feedback.
Assist in onboarding team members.
Handle incoming requests from EPs, Producers, and Editors.
Communicate project updates to the producing, programming team, and relevant stakeholders.
Organize the delivery of content deliverables.

Edit video, audio, graphics, and images.

Proven experience in coordinating post-production workflows and media asset management.
Proficiency in video and audio editing, graphics, and color correction.

Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Title: Manager, Data Foundations
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we treat Data as a Product - a valuable asset and a critical piece of our decision making process. The Data Foundations team is responsible for providing several capabilities:

Persistence for all client and service data, across multiple persistence solutions (PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, Redshift, Kafka, and graph databases).
Ingestion services, client libraries, and access patterns for all our operational persistence.
Retrieval services and libraries, caching services, and front-end infrastructure for engineering teams to understand and consume operational data.
Processing and routing pipelines that ensure privacy and compliance policies as data flows through the enterprise at the speed the business demands.

We are looking for an engaged, hands-on Engineering Manager to join our Data Foundations team to build and provide leadership across all four capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a passion for quality code and architecture, and will provide technical leadership as well as individual technical contribution as part of a team.Your team will be solving a wide range of problems related to data protection and security, observability across the entire ecosystem, and ensure the systems your build and support are highly available, secure, and provide the throughput our Members and Team Members demand. Our Members trust us to keep their data safe and secure, and youll play a key role in earning and keeping that trust, from guidance and implementation of data classification and retention policies, and ensuring sensitive data is protected and anonymized appropriately throughout the entire data lifecycle. As a people leader you will be responsible for career development and growth of your engineers, ensuring that they are motivated in doing their best work in line with their interests.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Staff and manage a team of engineers responsible for the Data Foundations, from data ingestion and routing, and meet all SLOs and SLAs for the products your team owns.
Be focused on eliminating toil within your team and your own customers through self-service tooling, and internally developed and published libraries for all the products you own.
Represent the Data Foundations team in internal customer meetings, cross functional workstreams,  maintain roadmaps for the team, help prioritize customer requests and drive iterative delivery of projects enabling our stakeholders to be successful. 
Establish team level performance indicators to measure efficiency of the teams output and impact to the Team Members we support.
Inspire a healthy, collaborative, empathetic engineering culture in line with Pelotons values, helping your team develop and grow along the engineering journey at Peloton.
Ensure that data pipelines are implemented with quality and observability included, along with appropriate encryption and tokenization techniques.
Partner closely with our security teams, ensuring logging and auditing mechanisms are in place and responding to any security incidents around the data infrastructure your teams support.
Champion engineering and operational excellence, drive database reliability and incident management by establishing metrics and processes for assessment and improvements.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

8+ years of software development experience in the data platform and datastores disciplines. You should be familiar with the inner workings of a data pipeline, understand the difference between streaming and batch processing data pipelines, and understand how a database engine builds a query plan.

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Data Scientist on the Product Analytics team to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our engagement products! This Data Scientist, Product will work as part of a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and User Researchers to better understand how members are interacting with Peloton products and to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product team. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 


Own analytics for one core workstream on Peloton digital apps, from metrics definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting, investigation, and generative research 


Be a key contributor to strategic decisions and roadmap formation for workstream


Collaborate with Product Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers to lead experimentation processes: designing and measuring A/B tests that help us understand the impact of new/alternate versions of features on user behavior


Define and own reporting and interpretation of KPIs & metrics for workstream, feature launches and A/B tests


Develop a deep understanding of user personas, fitness routines, and retention drivers for our members


Evaluate engagement trends across markets - compare workout/content engagement and feature usage among members within our growing global community


Become an authority on your workstream: provide insight into behaviors and difficulties of members on their journey from app download through sustained long-term engagement; help guide roadmap and evaluation of new features to enhance this user journey


Work in a lean and agile way, focusing on team members' desired outcomes over granular tasks and continuously assessing tradeoffs between precision and action-ability


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


BA/BS degree, preferably in a technical field


Have 3+ years of overall experience in an analytics capacity with a focus on problem-solving and providing concrete insights; some experience conducting analysis with a product/UX focus is desirable (an advanced degree may supply to years of experience)


Have solid technical skills when it comes to data wrangling and handling large datasets: can use SQL for data extraction (including sophisticated joins, CTE, window functions and query optimization), and have a proven understanding of Python syntax required for data cleaning and exploratory analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy)


Have experience with A/B testing and have demonstrated experience designing and assessing experiments


Have an understanding of statistics and data science methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, and other machine learning techniques such as clustering)


Have shown experience defining and owning project success metrics


Have a passion for data storytelling via decks and dashboards and a shown ability to efficiently communicate your insights to non-technical audiences and senior leadership


Are comfortable leading your project timelines, prioritizing tasks with user and business impact in mind, assessing speed/precision tradeoffs, and proactively communicating project statuses to collaborators and teammates


Work well collaboratively, both in a cross-functional context - with Product Managers, Project Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - and as a part of joint research projects with Product Analytics teammates


Are curious and humble: ask good questions, are always excited to learn new methods, approaches, and perspectives, and are eager to investigate interesting trends in the data 




Previous experience working on a product analytics team for a B2C software or software+hardware product


Solid understanding of event-based data collection and related technical concepts (e.g. SDK, device vs. cloud mode, schema management) and tools (e.g. Segment)


Experience with product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, etc.)


Experience with social engagement features/products, growth loops, network effects and product virality 


Understanding of adjacent quantitative and qualitative research methods and techniques (e.g. usability testing, concept testing, market sizing, etc.)

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the Data Science team. In this role, you will help scale Pelotons data infrastructure for business needs by building batch and streaming data pipelines that process terabytes of data daily. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple teams of engineers and business partners to support analytics and reporting data needs across the organization. 
This role will be hybrid, not remote.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Build and maintain data pipelines to support the data and analytics needs of different stakeholders across multiple business verticals including Supply Chain, Logistics, Finance, Marketing, Product, etc.

Collaborate with the team to develop best practices in building our next generation data platform.

Title: SOX ITGC (UAR) Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a skilled SOX ITGC Manager to lead our Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance efforts with a particular focus on User Access Review (UAR) controls and Identity Governance. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in IT general controls, risk management, and identity management frameworks. This role will be responsible for overseeing and managing the execution of the SOX User Access Review process to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations and company policies. This role requires a strong understanding of information security principles, regulatory requirements, and the ability to collaborate with external auditors, internal audit teams, and business leaders to ensure robust compliance with SOX controls and effective management of user access reviews. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in SOX compliance, audit management, and cross-functional collaboration.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

SOX Compliance Management:Oversee and manage SOX compliance activities related to IT General Controls (ITGC), ensuring timely execution of UAR and other related controls.
User Access Review (UAR):Design, implement, and monitor UAR processes to ensure that user access is appropriate and complies with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Identity Governance:Develop and maintain an identity governance framework to manage user identities, roles, and access rights across systems, ensuring least privilege access principles are adhered to.
Risk Assessment:Conduct regular risk assessments related to ITGC and identity management. Identify potential risks and recommend mitigation strategies to senior management.
Documentation and Reporting:Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all SOX controls, including policies, procedures, and process flows. Prepare and present regular compliance reports to management and auditors.
Collaboration:Work closely with IT teams, internal audit, and external auditors to facilitate audits and ensure compliance with SOX requirements.
Interface with External Auditors:Serve as the primary point of contact for external auditors regarding ITGC and UAR controls, ensuring that all necessary documentation and information are provided in a timely manner.
Training and Awareness:Develop training programs for staff on SOX compliance, UAR controls, and best practices in identity governance to foster a culture of compliance within the organization.
Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process improvements in compliance practices and implement best practices in identity governance.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, or a related field.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT compliance, risk management, or audit, with a focus on SOX.
Strong understanding of ITGC frameworks, SOX requirements, and UAR controls.
Experience with UAR identity governance tools (Sailpoint, CyberArk)
Familiarity with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CRISC) are a plus

Title: Advanced Manufacturing Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Advanced Manufacturing Engineer to join our team in Taichung, Taiwan. The successful candidate will play a critical role in designing and improving final assembly testing and packing (FATP) lines, driving the proper balance between low-cost automation and improving line efficiency from an industrialization point of view. This role requires a strong background in industrial engineering, process optimization, and continuous improvement methodologies. Additionally, the role involves working with third-party manufacturers to design takt times and cycle times, understand line flexibility, and assess the should-cost of manufacturing equipment and manufacturing value added (MVA).
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Line Design and Optimization:

Design, develop, and optimize FATP lines to enhance production efficiency, product quality, and cost-effectiveness, balancing low-cost automation and industrialization requirements.


Collaboration with Third-Party Manufacturers:

Partner with third-party manufacturing partners to ensure adherence to Pelotons quality standards and production timelines in FATP operations.


Takt and Cycle Times:

Design and optimize takt times and cycle times in collaboration with third-party manufacturers to ensure efficient production flow and flexibility.


Cost Assessment:

Understand and assess the should-cost of manufacturing equipment and manufacturing value added (MVA) to ensure cost-effective production processes.


Process Improvement:

Lead continuous improvement initiatives using Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma principles to identify and eliminate waste, reduce variation, and improve overall FATP line performance.


Industrial Engineering Expertise:

Apply industrial engineering principles to develop efficient workstations, workflows, and assembly processes for FATP, focusing on the balance between automation and manual processes.


Data Analysis and Reporting:

Utilize data-driven approaches to monitor, analyze, and report on FATP line performance metrics. Implement corrective actions as necessary.


New Product Introduction (NPI):

Support the transition of new products from design to final assembly, ensuring that FATP lines are capable of producing at the required quality and volume.


Training and Development: Train and mentor production staff and junior engineers in advanced FATP techniques and continuous improvement methodologies.
Compliance and Safety:

Ensure all FATP processes comply with industry standards and regulations. Promote a culture of safety within the manufacturing environment.



YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Education:

 Bachelors degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field. English and Mandarin required.


Experience:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced manufacturing engineering, with a focus on designing and improving FATP lines in a high-volume manufacturing environment.


Technical Skills:

Proficiency in CAD/CAM software, knowledge of automated testing systems, and efficient packing methodologies. Familiarity with industrial engineering principles and practices.


Problem-Solving:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven track record of implementing successful FATP line improvements.


Communication:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Mandarin.


Team Player:

Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Certification:

Lean Six Sigma certification (Green Belt or higher) is preferred.

Title: Senior Hardware Engineering Program Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, exceptional hardware is key to delighting our customers. We are seeking a Senior Engineering Program Manager (EPM) to drive planning and execution of large-scale, cross-team initiatives. This role is within Hardware Product Development reporting to the EPM Director. They will  work closely with Product Management, Industrial Design, Quality, Engineering, Software, and Manufacturing. The ideal candidate has incredible organization skills and is able to get things done with timeliness, difficulty, and autonomy while building strong teams.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Be the glue that helps the team get things done on time, on budget, in full.
Ensure all team members understand the business value and goals tied to the effort.
Scope and plan projects: set goals and important metrics, build project plans, identify key partners, identify risks and contingency plans, develop a change management plan.

 YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Strong leadership skills and ability to inspire team members. 
Project management training, certification, or experience, PMP certification preferred.

Title: Engineering Manager, iOS
RoleDescription:
About the Role
Our team owns the apps that bring Pelotons workout experience to iOS, tvOS, watchOS, Android mobile and WearOS. We build native Swift and Kotlin applications that engage our members who own Peloton hardware as well as those members whose only touchpoint with the brand is via their mobile device or TV. Pelotons mobile apps are an important and growing focus for the company, as they provide an easy way for new users to engage with Pelotons high-quality content at a greater range of price points. In this role, you will work with the team that builds features for the Peloton mobile and tv applications. You will also work with our Product, Design, and backend teams to identify and inform the platform elements required to support client-side features.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead engineering team in cross-functional project launches
Mentor engineers through technical coaching and professional development
Collaborate with product management and design to translate project requirements into technical implementations
Participate in system design and architecture conversations
Primary focus on team leadership and strategic guidance, with minimal direct coding responsibilities
Drive continuous improvement in team processes, technical infrastructure, and delivery capabilities
Drive the annual performance process and deliver regular performance feedback

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

4+ years of mobile app development experience
2+ years leading a team of engineers
Expert-level knowledge of iOS (Swift) and/or Android (Kotlin/Java) development
Strong understanding of modern architecture patterns and principles
Experience developing integrations with RESTful APIs
Experience with mobile CI/CD, testing frameworks, and performance optimization
Proficiency in mobile app performance monitoring and debugging
Knowledge of mobile analytics and user experience optimization

LEADERSHIP & SOFT SKILLS

Excellent communication skills across technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to effectively translate Product, UX, and UI requirements into technical details.
Ability to evaluate and communicate engineering solutions and trade-offs to teammates and other, potentially non-technical teams.
Strategic thinking with ability to balance short-term delivery and long-term technical vision
Strong mentorship and coaching capabilities
Data-driven decision-making approach
